results.title: A Mile in our Shoes
results.creator_credit: Daniel Walker, Karl Armstrong, Steph Winward, The Junction, Middlesbrough Football Club Study Support, Riverside Studios and First Light
results.brief_description: The average age of a young carer in the UK is 12. This is a poignant and moving tribute to those many young carers tending to parents or siblings or both. They manage the domestic needs of a household as well as the physical needs of those they are caring for. They sometimes care for more than one family member with ailments ranging from autism to muscular dystrophy. With a constant lack of understanding from the rest of the world, no wonder there is little time for sleep let alone a social life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Daniel Walker, Karl Armstrong, Steph Winward, The Junction, Middlesbrough Football Club Study Support, Riverside Studios and First Light

results.title: A Midsummer night's dream: introduction to the play
results.brief_description: Excerpts from the play are used to introduce the audience to the setting of the play, to explain the basic structure of the plot and to familiarise students with specific characters and their relationships with one another. Selected scenes, speeches and actions are presented to motivate keener interest and a clearer understanding of the play.

Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.

results.title: A Midsummer night's dream
results.brief_description: The Lindsay Kemp Company in a production of “A Midsummer Night’s Dream” by William Shakespeare. Hermia, daughter of Egeus is in love with Lysander, but has been ordered by Theseus, who is to marry the defeated queen of the Amazons, Hippolyta, to wed Demetrius, who is loved by Helena. The four young people flee to the forest where they are found by Oberon, king of the fairies, Titania, his wife with whom he is in ill humour, and the merry Puck. Using a love potion somewhat indiscriminately, Puck manages to effect a remarkable chain of romantic entanglements which are eventually resolved to everyone’s satisfaction. PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS IS A MUSICAL PRODUCTION BASED ON SHAKESPEARE’S TEXT AND NOT A PERFORMANCE OF THE PLAY ITSELF.

results.title: A Micmac scale basket: national Indian arts and crafts
results.creator_credit: Geoff Voyce and B T Film-Sound
results.brief_description: The Micmac Indians have been making splint baskets out of black ash for hundreds of years. Rita and Noel Michael from Shibenacadic reserve continue this ancient handicraft, creating many different styles to suit various needs. In this film they make a traditional scale basket, from rough log to the finished product.

results.title: A Message from the party
results.brief_description: Vivien spends his days plotting revolution and planning his manifesto for takeover. Part satire, part mock-documentry, this short cleverly uses ‘found’ super 8 footage to chart one man’s mania and the power struggles that take place on the domestic front.

results.title: A Memoir of the Bunurongs
results.brief_description: A brief memoir recording the sights, sounds and essence of Sorrento, a small seaside town nestled in between Portsea and Blairgowrie on the Mornington Peninsula. Evocative images are accompanied by a music soundtrack and text (in English).

results.title: A meeting of ways
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Describes the process of organising a community art project for a newly-opened community centre in Melbourne called Ross House. This program records the joys, the frustrations, the tears, the highs and the lows in the making of community art.
